title: Getting better.

embed.description: Hello, in this super serious ranked series, I'm trying to improve and get better. This is low elo. (Silver) So feel free to point out my mistakes so I can work on them. Also, sorry for the beeps, phone messages OP.

body: This is mainly to help myself improve.

replies.body: I don't want to say much since I'm same elo as you ahah, but have you tried Doran's shield start against those match ups? I feel like the sustain and tankyness could be nice.

Outside perspective is still nice tho.
You can pick up on things that I cannot.

Anyway, the reason I don't go dorans shield as gnar, is because I feel like he can make more use of dorans blade better.
That and Irelia, kinda ignores that flat 5 block with her flat 5 true dmg.

So I would rather the AD range + lifesteal for sustain and extra DMG.

Just as a note, the reason to go Doran's Shield isn't "this person is going to hit me" it's "this person does single target damage" which irelia does till 6.

Doran's Blade is a fine start on a gnar, but not into an Irelia because she is able to jump to you and if you can't time the jump quickly enough your gonna take a lot of damage, Doran's Shield negates a decent chunk of this.

First few minutes: There was no point placing your ward because of the skirmish, go back and you will notice that Jax was spotted bottom side, your ward actually has no effect and just removes your ward for 2 minutes.

Re exhaust: honestly your a tank with a shit ton of CC/peel, exhaust was unnecessary especially given both comp's, you have a lulu support who also has exhaust and has her W (polymorph) this is a lot of ability to negate damage, and honestly you shouldn't need it for more then 2 in their comp at a time (unless they do a team dive, in which case your gnar.), and your champ comes with a lot of peel in built so it's kinda not worth taking. Taking TP gives you the ability to fall behind in lane and be fine by being able to back earlier, and also to be able to make plays around the map, whereas Exhaust is going to be rather lackluster until at least 20-30 minutes where grouping starts.

Early laning: Try to avoid using your Q to CS, focus your auto's on that and this allows you to poke your enemy laner.

Level 2: I would actually recommend taking E second against an Irelia just in case she try's to all in you early, gives you the ability to jump back and kite her out. (and this was proven by what she did i'm actually typing these as i watch)

Level 3: you actually had the ability to jump in for a trade, Mega Gnar means your tanky, this means better trading even against an Irelia, instead you jumped in for a CS when you were about to lose mega gnar and lost the trade.

Level 4: here is where TP would help over the exhaust, you would be able to back and not miss CS with this early miss trade.

Level 6: you had minion advantage and hit 6 with the transform and a decent window to jump Irelia before she realized and backed up.

Early buys against true damage: Health > Armor, the armor won't help you as much as the raw health in a matchup like this one.

Irelia's ult: this thing is like on a 60 second cooldown.

Level 7: here's your chance to freeze the lane, instead you reset it.

Level 8: either max your Q/W don't split levels.

Xin gank: honestly you could have saved the Exhaust if you Q'd and gave her that slow instead.

Level 9: you warded when Jax was visible bot side, ward wasted for at least 10-15 seconds (and this got swept before it was actually useful).

Getting the 2 CS you probably could have held till you were mini to get your Q off cooldown sooner.

When your safe and hard pushing use your E, lesser known thing about the jump is you get bonus attack speed for 3 seconds.

I'm gonna stop watching here cause this post is massive.

I like taking exhaust, because as I said. I targets I hit with it, Like zed or there ADC do reduced dmg.
I felt like it was justified over TP, sure I wouldn't have missed CS. But I wasn't really getting any was I?

I know mega gnar is tankier, but Im not risking failing the trade and giving her more of a lead.

And yeah, I should have frozen the lane I do agree.
And I also should not have split levels, I have no idea what I was doing then._

You weren't getting any CS because you were zoned, and honestly, there is no point having 2 exhaust's AND a lulu polymorph on the same team.

If you were mid lane it might be a bit more justified as you would have been laning against the Zed, but again that early in the game it's just a mostly wasted summoner spell.

As for Mega Gnar engage, if you had of looked back you would have seen you had something like 6-8 minions, and honestly that means a won trade especially since you just hit 6.

You can never have too much exhaust, but I do see your point.
And I should have payed more attention to Minions + level.

I was just waay to focused on not feeding.
Which isn't a bad thing, and luckily for me. Xin did help out twice which was enough for me to be relevant in the game.

Alight lot of stuff I'd like to clear up, so get comfortable ;)

1. You wont miss out on sustain by getting Doran's Shield because it has plus 6 health regeneration per 5 seconds. Doran's Blade gives 3% life steal. Even if you had 100 AD levels 1 - 4 say, you would only regenerate 3 health per auto. And since life-steal goes off the damage you deal, you'll get even less health after you calculate in the minion's armour. 
To make Doran's Blade better regeneration wise, you would have to be able to auto attack 2-3 times every 5 seconds. Which to me indicates that you would be laning quite comfortably and possibly even winning. If you look back to the later parts of your laning phase you weren't able to auto-attack sometimes for up to 15 seconds because she was zoning you.

2. Lets also clear up Irelia's W. You need to know your enemy. She gets passively 5 flat HEALTH REGENERATION (not true damage) as an on-hit effect. Only when activated does she get 15 true damage for 6 seconds.
There's actually a lot of evidence suggesting that Doran's Shield blocks damage from on-hit abilities (meaning it would block some of Irelia's W, read more about that [here](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3707617) .)

3. But in your defence none of the evidence is official, so even if it didn't block Irelia W, Doran's Shield is still better, here's why;
With Doran's Blade you take say 70 damage from her auto-attacks plus 15 true damage. That's 85 damage total.
With Doran's Blade you take 62 damage from her auto-attacks plus 15 true damage. That's 77 damage total.

Plus with Doran's Shield you have 10 extra health compared to Doran's Blade, making you slightly tankier.

Essentially if you think you're going to win your lane then take Doran's Blade, but you didn't seem very hopeful at the start and you ended up losing lane. So I think it's worth trying out Doran's Shield against some of these match-ups.

Hmm ok, Ive never actually run the numbers before.
Its just *According to statistics on third party websites*
I do 90% better when I start dorans, but when I start shield I lose way more games.

But that is rather helping so thank you :)

The problem is your not actually considering what these stats actually mean.

In cases where both Doran's blade and Doran's Shield are viable 9/10 times you will see doran's blade have more win percentage, why?

Because Doran's Blade is taken into WINNING matchups and Doran's Shield is taken into LOSING matchups.

This doesn't actually mean that shield is worse, it just means that it's more viable in a bad matchup.
That's interesting actually. Doran's Shield Gnar isn't exactly OP but it should be decent in some match ups. Well keep doing what works for you!

I usually do, don't fix something that isn't broken.
And you too...? I guess?
